org.araneaframework.http.filter
Class StandardStateVersioningFilterWidget

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.core.BaseComponent
      org.araneaframework.core.BaseService
          org.araneaframework.core.BaseWidget
              org.araneaframework.framework.core.BaseFilterWidget
                  org.araneaframework.http.filter.StandardStateVersioningFilterWidget
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Component, FilterWidget, StateVersioningContext, Service, Widget
public class StandardStateVersioningFilterWidget
extends BaseFilterWidget
implements StateVersioningContext

Filter that supports Aranea state versioning. It keeps its "childWidgets" in serialized form associated with a state ID. When a request comes in, it deserializes a childWidget with appropriate state ID and delegates actions to it. When a request ends, it serializes and stores the childWidget once again.

Also note that not every state is requested from the client side when the user navigates using the browser's back/forward buttons. Those pages where update regions exist, exist in a state with an ID that does not begin with "HTTP". Only those are requested by "aranea-rsh.js". Those page where state ID starts with "HTTP" are handled by "rsh.js". However, this widget needs to remember all the states to return to those as the user wishes.

Since:
1.2
Author:
Taimo Peelo (taimo@araneaframework.org), Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

DEFAULT_MAX_STATES_STORED

public static final int DEFAULT_MAX_STATES_STORED
Default number of states that is stored when this StandardStateVersioningFilterWidget is present in component hierarchy.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATES_COOKIE_NAME_SUFFIX

public static final String STATES_COOKIE_NAME_SUFFIX
See Also:
Constant Field Values

originalState

protected static byte[] originalState
This field will be filled in when the first request comes in and before the request will be processed by child components. Since the initial state is the same for all threads, we keep it in a static variable.

lastStateId

protected String lastStateId
The ID of the state the that incoming request expects to be the last. This is filled in before a request is processed. Therefore, methods can expect this value to be up-to-date and don't have to resolve it each time.

newStateId

protected String newStateId
The ID of the current state as it will be saved. This is filled in before a request is processed. Therefore, methods can expect this value to be up-to-date and don't have to resolve it each time.

Since:
2.0

versionedStates

protected LinkedList<StateVersioningContext.State> versionedStates
Map of states that this versioning system keeps track of. When using client side state storage, this map consists of Map<String stateId, byte[] stateSHA1Digest>. When using server-side state storage Map<String stateId, byte[] serializedState>

expiredDuringRequest

protected boolean expiredDuringRequest

stateSaved

protected transient ThreadLocal<Boolean> stateSaved

setChildWidget

public void setChildWidget(Widget childWidget)
Sets the child to childWidget decorated with RelocatableDecorator. This is mainly used internally as the childWidget is serialized and later restored.

The difference between this and the parent implementation of this method is that the childWidget is relocatable here.

addStatesCookie

protected void addStatesCookie(OutputData output)

handleStateRestoration

protected void handleStateRestoration(boolean event)
                               throws Exception
Executes generalized logic to restore a correct state. Therefore, it's not just about restoring a state, but also about resolving the state ID, handling cases when state is expired.

Parameters:
event - This parameter should be set to true when the state is restored for an event. Otherwise should be false.
Throws:
Exception
Since:
2.0

Returns:
The value of the parameter as it is in global data.
Since:
2.0

getStateIdFromRequest

protected String getStateIdFromRequest()
Retrieves the state ID value from the request. When the value starts with StateVersioningContext.HTTP_REQUEST_LOOKUP_PREFIX, the value will be resolved into the last HTTP state ID before the given non-HTTP value.

Returns:
The requested state ID.
Since:
2.0

resolvePreviousStateId

protected String resolvePreviousStateId()
Resolves the ID of the state to use as base state for handling the current request. Usually returns the state ID from the request or the last known state ID. Note that it is not verified whether the ID is valid or whether we have a non-expired state for it - it will be done in checkStateExpired().

Returns:
The ID of an existing state to use for handling the current request.
Since:
2.0

resolveCurrentStateId

protected String resolveCurrentStateId()

getCurrentStateId

public String getCurrentStateId()
Specified by:
getCurrentStateId in interface StateVersioningContext

checkStateExpired

protected void checkStateExpired()
This method will be called after requested state ID has been resolved to analyze the validness of the ID.

Since:
2.0

storeOriginalState

protected void storeOriginalState()

writeHeaders

protected void writeHeaders()
Sets the response headers that disallow caching in general but still allow for using of browser history navigation facilities (back/forward buttons) in most browsers (IE, FF, Opera). Safari seems to behaves badly in regard to the RFC.

Sets the state ID as a header, which is needed when an AJAX request is coming from the client.

restoreState

protected void restoreState()
                     throws Exception
Chooses the appropriate state and restores it.

Throws:
Exception

restoreState

protected void restoreState(byte[] serializedState)

saveState

public StateVersioningContext.State saveState()
Acquires current state and when server-side state versioning is used, stores that for later use. When this StandardStateVersioningFilterWidget is configured to hold state on client, it will only register state identifier and state checksums, returned state must be saved by someone else.

Specified by:
saveState in interface StateVersioningContext
Returns:
The current state with its identifier.

discardInaccessibleStates

protected void discardInaccessibleStates()
When the base state is not the last and the new state is not versioned (is new), we discard all states after lastStateId to save some space, because browser back/forward button also discards these states.

This method should be called when last and new state IDs are resolved, the previous state is restored, but before the new state ID is saved (e.g. in handleStateRestoration(boolean). This method will also notify listeners about updated changes.

Since:
2.0

discardOldStatesOnLimitExceed

protected void discardOldStatesOnLimitExceed()
When maxVersionedStates is exceeded, this method will start removing the old states until the limit is not exceeded anymore.

This method will NOT notify any listeners about changed states because, by default, this method is used by saveState(), which takes care of notifying, too.

Since:
2.0

logStatus

protected void logStatus()

formatSize

protected static String formatSize(long size)
Does the given size formatting to represent it in bytes. For example, for input value 2048, returns "2MB". Supports formatting units up to TB.

Parameters:
size - The size value to format.
Returns:
The string of formatted input size together with unit information.
Since:
2.0

setMaxVersionedStates

public void setMaxVersionedStates(int maxVersionedStates)
Sets the maximum number of states that are tracked by this StandardStateVersioningFilterWidget. It should be rather small number when states are stored on server-side and rather large number when states are stored on client side.

Parameters:
maxVersionedStates - number of states to keep track of

expire

public void expire()
Description copied from interface: StateVersioningContext
Expires all stored versioned states. Should be called when current flow has completed some truly irreversible operation — e.g. calling remote service to bill a credit card etc etc.

Specified by:
expire in interface StateVersioningContext

notifyAboutNavigation

protected void notifyAboutNavigation(boolean action)

notifyUsualNavigation

protected void notifyUsualNavigation()
Notifies StateVersioningContext.ClientNavigationAware components that a usual navigation has occurred on client-side. "Usual" means that user clicked on link or button on the last returned page. The user did not use browser history buttons.

Since:
2.0

notifyCurrentStateUpdate

protected void notifyCurrentStateUpdate()
Notifies StateVersioningContext.ClientNavigationAware components that an action request has arrived and that will just update the last rendered state.

Since:
2.0

notifyHistoryNavigation

protected void notifyHistoryNavigation()
Notifies StateVersioningContext.ClientNavigationAware components that a browser history based navigation has occurred on client-side.

Since:
2.0

notifyStatesUpdated

protected void notifyStatesUpdated()
Notifies StateVersioningContext.ClientNavigationAware components that our states have been updated (i.e. a state has expired, was removed and/or a new state has been added).

Since:
2.0
